text: Konstantin Nikolayevich Korneyev (; born June 5, 1984 in Moscow, Russian SFSR, Soviet Union) is a Russian professional ice hockey defenceman who is currently an unrestricted free agent. He most recently played for Severstal Cherepovets of the Kontinental Hockey League (KHL). ==Playing career== Drafted by the Montreal Canadiens of the National Hockey League (NHL) in 2002(9th round, 275th overall), Korneyev has played with Krylya Sovetov Moscow, Ak Bars Kazan and CSKA Moscow in Russia, but has not played in the NHL. He wins Russian Superleague 2006 with Ak Bars. During the summer of 2011 he was removed as a prospect from the Montreal Canadiens website indicating a possible rupture in their association, however this has not yet been verified. On December 24, 2010, he was traded from HC CSKA Moscow to Ak Bars Kazan for defenseman Vyacheslav Buravchikov and a financial compensation.
